metadata.synopsis: You talk to a shadar-kai from the shadowfell. He tasks you with collecting memories from the dead.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to 106.70, 52.50, 104.66 and the dialog will auto-start.

81.speaker: He Who Was
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Using SWD on the corpse of a dwarf. NodeContext: Shadar-Kai speaks in a cold, calculated tone.

65.speaker: Madeline
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse CollapsesNodeContext: Speak with dead style

29.speaker: He Who Was
29.text: You walk in the darkness, unafraid? How curious.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Playing with the dead, are we? How charming.

44.speaker: He Who Was
44.text: Indeed. One whose secrets are not for your ears. Be on your way.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Were you just talking to a corpse?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I've met few who can also commune with the dead.

13.speaker: He Who Was
13.text: And I have met few who stand so tall and fearless in the face of the unknown. Be on your way, brave soul.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player, gestures to bodyNodeContext: talking about yourself

43.speaker: He Who Was
43.text: A fair point - perhaps this one could assist us.

3.speaker: He Who Was
3.text: The murdered lie silent. The raven asks - will you be their voice?

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *The raven, the piercings, the general malaise: this is a shadar-kai. Tales and songs featuring servants of the Raven Queen tend to be tragedies.*

45.speaker: He Who Was
45.text: She is not the victim. Nay, she is the perpetrator.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Speak plainly - what are you talking about?

31.speaker: He Who Was
31.text: Forgive me - it has been some time since I spoke to another.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Why does the raven want to know?

61.speaker: He Who Was
61.text: He thinks you strong enough for the task at hand.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I will always seek justice for the wronged.

42.speaker: He Who Was
42.text: Then you and I were fated to meet.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Death often comes for a reason. I've killed before, does that make me a murderer?

22.speaker: He Who Was
22.text: Depends. Did those you kill trust you? Care for you?
22.context: NodeContext: player says 'I've killed before, does that make me a murderer?'

84.speaker: He Who Was
84.text: This woman tended a bar where she took her patrons, her friends, into her confidence - promised their secrets were safe with her.

30.speaker: He Who Was
30.text: Yet she turned their words into knives - and stabbed them in the back.

1.speaker: He Who Was
1.text: They died because of her - and to this day her victims lie unavenged.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: She's dead - how much more can she pay?

62.speaker: He Who Was
62.text: Death is not the end - merely another beginning.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Her soul has departed for the Fugue Plane, to be judged or lost forever. What more could she pay?

79.speaker: He Who Was
79.text: The Fugue Plane is no obstacle to one such as I.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I doubt you're here out of the goodness of your heart.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: What good is murder if it isn't done in the name of the divine? It would be an honour to punish her.

11.speaker: He Who Was
11.text: You see it as I do.

16.speaker: He Who Was
16.text: I seek a record of this one's crimes - written in her own hand.

56.speaker: He Who Was
56.text: Through it, I can summon her spirit - and force her to face trial for her crimes.

15.speaker: He Who Was
15.text: My reasons are of no consequence.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: That's some powerful magic - how do you do it? Can you show me?

4.speaker: He Who Was
4.text: Such spells are ancient secrets, and closely guarded - but I could be convinced to share them with an ally.
4.context: NodeContext: a smile - he knows he has the player (he's lying)

50.speaker: He Who Was
50.text: Your soul sparks with vengeance. With fury. This is your chance to torment a murderer. To make her suffer.
50.context: NodeContext: his big pitch - determined, passionate, a touch zealous

33.speaker: He Who Was
33.text: Your soul sparks with justice. With fortitude. This is your chance to bring a murderer to justice. To avenge her victims.
33.context: NodeContext: his big pitch - determined, passionate, a touch zealous

20.speaker: He Who Was
20.text: Not for one such as I.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: What do you need me to do?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Hardly a fair trial - you've already decided her guilt. Why?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I will - what must I do?

12.speaker: He Who Was
12.text: I thank you - as do those who died by her words.

70.speaker: He Who Was
70.text: Go to the distillery, the one she calls The Waning Moon. Find the ledger - and bring it to me.
70.context: NodeContext: [GL] set for rerecord, original read was too angry. Please listen to proceeding lines for tone level

82.speaker: Player
82.text: So long as I get paid.

23.speaker: He Who Was
23.text: The death of heroism is close, I see.

67.speaker: He Who Was
67.text: A pity - I thought I sensed the spark of heroes in you.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You are not an impartial judge. Why have you decided her guilt already?

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Kill the dead. Kill the killed dead. Kill the killed dead again and again.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Your mind swoons with possibilities, this blessed loon may murder the same soul as many times as he wishes.*

40.speaker: He Who Was
40.text: No. I seek only justice - not murderous deviancy.

27.speaker: He Who Was
27.text: I offer you a chance to avenge this murderer's victims. Will you take it?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: It sounds like she must be punished - thoroughly.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Then we should seek revenge on her behalf.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: It is an honour to meet one of the Raven Queen's scions. What brings you here?

32.speaker: He Who Was
32.text: For your kind to know Her ways is rare. You will suit the task at hand well.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Not many people out here in the darkness.

25.speaker: He Who Was
25.text: I am not 'people'. Though many would question how wise it is to approach a stranger in the dark. Be on your way.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: That spell - Speak With Dead, correct? Your technique is impeccable.

46.speaker: He Who Was
46.text: When you have lived as long as I, such simple magic becomes second nature.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You look tough - good. It's more fun that way.

72.speaker: He Who Was
72.text: Stay your hand, and be on your way. I'll not raise mine against you.
